advance.name: Monument
advance.info: Gives 20 extra bonus which can be spent on colors.

advance.name: Wonder of the World
advance.info: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire 1 additional trade card for free from a stack number that is higher than your number of cities in play. Wonder of the World counts as a city during the A.S.T.-Alteration phase.

advance.name: Architecture
advance.info: Once per turn, when constructing a city, you may choose to pay up to half of the required number of tokens from treasury. You are allowed to use the ability when building a wilderness city.

advance.name: Mining
advance.info: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 6 and/or stack 8 for 13 treasury tokens per card. Treasury tokens are worth 2 points when purchasing Civilization Advances.

advance.name: Cloth Making
advance.info: Your ships are allowed to move 5 steps.

advance.name: Naval Warfare
advance.info: Your ships are allowed to carry 6 tokens. In conflicts, you may choose to remove ships from the conflict area instead of tokens. After each round of token removal a new check for token majority must be made.

advance.name: Diaspora
advance.special: May move 5 tokens anywhere on the map if population limit is not reached.

advance.name: Urbanism
advance.info: Once per turn, when constructing a wilderness city you may choose to use up to 4 tokens from areas adjacent by land. - In combination with Architecture this means a wilderness city can be built in an area containing 2 tokens, using 4 tokens from adjacent areas and 6 tokens from treasury.

advance.name: Diplomacy
advance.immunity: Players are not allowed to move tokens into areas containing your cities, except for areas where a conflict situation already occurs. This does not count for players holding Diplomacy or Military.

advance.name: Provincial Empire
advance.special: Up to 5 adjacent players give you a 2+ commodity of their choice.

advance.name: Monarchy
advance.info: You may choose to increase your tax rate by 1.

records.advance: Cultural Ascendancy 5 6 BLUE 280 20 5 1" Can not be a target of Politics from other players. Cultural Ascendancy of other players is ignored. Players are not allowed to cause conflict in areas containing your units, except for areas where a conflict situation already occurs. This does not count for players holding Cultural Ascendancy or Advanced Military. Your default city support rate is increased by 1.

advance.name: Written Record
advance.info: Acquire 10 additional points of credit tokens in any combination of colors.

advance.name: Cartography
advance.info: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 2 for 5 treasury tokens and/or from stack 7 for 13 treasury tokens per card.

advance.name: Library
advance.info: ou may discount the cost of 1 other Civilization Advance that you purchase in the same turn as Library by 40 points.

advance.name: Agriculture
advance.info: The population limit of 0, 1 and 2 areas on the board is increased by 1 for you as long as these areas do not contain any other playerâ€™s units or barbarian tokens.

advance.name: Democracy
advance.info: During the Tax Collection phase you collect tax as usual but your cities do not revolt as a result of a shortage in tax collection.

advance.name: Engineering
advance.info: Other players or barbarians require 8 tokens to successfully attack your cities. Your cities are then replaced with 7 tokens. This does not apply when the attacking player also holds Engineering. You require 6 tokens to successfully attack other playerâ€™s cities or pirate cities. Their cities are then replaced with 5 tokens. This does not apply when the defending player also holds Engineering.

advance.name: Roadbuilding
advance.info: When moving over land, your tokens may move 2 areas. Tokens that are in a conflict situation after 1 step are not allowed to move any further. Your hand limit of trade cards is increased by 1.

advance.name: Anatomy
advance.info: Upon purchase, you may choose to acquire 1 science card with an undiscounted cost of less than 100 for free.

advance.name: Fundamentalism
advance.special: May destroy all units in one area that is adjacent by land.
advance.immunity: Can not be targeted by Fundamentalism.

advance.name: Monotheism
advance.special: May annex all units in one area that is adjacent by land.
advance.immunity: Can not be a target of Monotheism from other players.

advance.name: Theocracy

effect.name: Iconoclasm and Heresy (prevent by discarding 2 commodity cards)

advance.info: Iconoclasm and Heresy: You may choose and discard 2 commodity cards to prevent the city reduction effect for you.

advance.name: Universal Doctrine
advance.special: May annex 1 pirate city or up to 5 barbarians anywhere on the map.

advance.name: Theology
advance.immunity: Can not be a target of Monotheism from other players.

advance.name: Rhetoric
advance.info: During the Trade Cards Acquisition phase, you may acquire additional trade cards from stack 3 for 9 treasury tokens per card.

advance.name: Politics
advance.special: Gain 5 treasury from stock, or pay to annex an adjacent area (1 treasury per unit).
advance.immunity: Can not be a target of Politics from other players.

advance.name: Philosophy
advance.immunity: Can not be targeted by Fundamentalism.

advance.name: Astronavigation
advance.info: Your ships are allowed to move through open sea areas. - Your ships may not end in an open sea area.

advance.name: Public Works
advance.info: Areas containing your cities may also contain 1 of your tokens.

advance.name: Coinage
advance.info: You may choose to increase or decrease your tax rate by 1.

advance.name: Trade Routes
advance.special: Discard any commodities for twice their face value in treasury tokens.

advance.name: Trade Empire
advance.info: Once per turn, you may choose to use 1 substitute commodity card of at least the same face value when turning in an incomplete set of commodity cards.

advance.name: Metalworking
advance.immunity: Metallworking from other players is ignored.
advance.info: In conflicts, for each round of token removal all other players not holding Metalworking must remove their token first.

advance.name: Military
advance.immunity: Diplomacy of other players is ignored.
advance.info: Your movement phase is after all other players not holding Military have moved. You are allowed to move tokens into areas containing cities belonging to players holding Diplomacy.

advance.name: Advanced Military
advance.immunity: Cultural Ascendancy of other players is ignored.
advance.info: In conflicts, you may choose to remove tokens from areas adjacent by land. After each round of token removal a new check for token majority must be made. You may decide to wait for other token conflicts to be resolved first. You are allowed to cause conflict in areas containing units belonging to players holding Cultural Ascendancy.
